rationale: The agent added the timeout parameter exposure in RestNodesInfoAction.java as required, but placed it in the wrong location. Ground truth adds it at line 104 within the doGet method alongside other parameter settings (transport, http, plugin), while the agent placed it at line 109 within the executeNodeRequest method. This placement difference is functionally problematic because the timeout should be configured with the other request parameters during request preparation, not in the execution method. The executeNodeRequest method is called after the request configuration is complete, making this placement architecturally incorrect and inconsistent with the existing pattern where all request parameter configurations are grouped together. Both diffs use identical code (nodesInfoRequest.timeout(request.paramAsTime("timeout", nodesInfoRequest.timeout()))), showing correct reuse. No unsolicited documentation was added.
